newsitem.title: USA: Enron, Portland Genl ready for Oregon talks.
newsitem.headline: Enron, Portland Genl ready for Oregon talks.

text.p: Enron Corp said recommendations from the Oregon Public Utilities Commission staff are being reviewed with Portland General Corp, and the companies are prepared to begin settlement discussions next week.

"The most significant factor is that the staff has recommended approval of the merger," Enron said in a statement. "While the approval has a number of conditions attached to it, we don't want to over analyze the dollar figures attached to the recommendations that remain preliminary at this stage."
Enron said the commission has scheduled settlement conferences in the proceeding for January 22-24 and will issue a final recommendation and a proposed order on January 31.
The commission is scheduled to make a final decision on March 17.

"We are extremely pleased that the staff did not use this proceeding to settle industry-wide restructuring issues," said Portland General Electric senior vice president Al Alexanderson. "It further endorses the support we received for the merger just last week from a wide ranging group of ... natural resource and public interest groups."
Enron said the companies believe "the staff's methodology and assumptions on certain conditions ... raise fundamental policy issues."

Stating "we are in the middle of a complex procedure," Enron said "it would be premature to provide further detail on our position on on these issues until we have had an opportunity to discuss them directly with the staff."
